page.title: 04THE LIBRARY, SWADLINCOTE.
page.content: The{library}is{25 years old.}It is split into{2 sections, fiction & non {fiction.}Inside is a small{reference {library}where you can't take the books home. The library has{40 000}books.{10 people work there & there are{11 498 members. Approximately{5 000}people come in every week. There is a{record library for older members &{stories}on tape for younger ones. It is free to join & you can take out up to 4 books for a month. If the books are brought back overdue it costs 1p per day for the first 3 weeks. For the 4th week 30p, 5th 45p, 6th 50p, that is the maximum amount. You don't have to pay a fine until you are over 11 years old. In the{summer holiday}a{library {van}comes round{Gresley}with a big selection of books so that people don't have to walk to Swadlincote.
